title: Worked Solution
text:
To determine whether $$y= rac{3}{5}$$ is a solution to the equation, we substitute $$y= rac{3}{5}$$ into the equation and simplify:

$$5y+3=10y-4$$

$$5\left( rac{3}{5}ight)+3=\operatorname{10}\left( rac{3}{5}ight)-4$$ (substituting y=3/5)

$$3+3=6-4$$

$$6=2$$

This is a false statement, since $$6$$ does not equal $$2$$. Therefore, $$y= rac{3}{5}$$ is not a solution to the equation.
